TestCase.TestCaseTitle: Create and update Holdings as ControlFeatures.
TestCase.TestCaseObjective: BSO validation. To verify basic functionality regarding Holdings (not yet clear what a 'Holding' within MIP4 will be, see remarks on MIP4-IES Test Case Directory): test adding and updating Persons, Equipment and Consumable Materiel Holdings.
TestCase.TestCaseScenario: Two nations are exchanging information between their C2ISs. Nation A will add Holding information to an Organisation and send it to Nation B. Nation A will then update the Holding information, and send the updated information to Nation B.
TestCase.TestCaseEnvironment: Internet or Co-located. Exchange Pattern: R/R, P/S.
TestCase.TestCasePreCondition: Nation B has a subscription to Nation A's 'Forces' topic. A friend Organisation has been created by Nation A in the 'Forces' topic.
TestCase.TestCaseConclusion: Holding information created by Nation A is received by Nation B. Updates to existing Holding information made by Nation A are received by Nation B. Holding information is shared correctly by the C2ISs of both nations.

TestCaseStep.TestCaseStepAction: Nation A creates three types of Holdings (just a raw 'ControlFeature' message element with associations to the Persons, Equipment and Materiel it contains?) for an existing Organisation (How can this figures be specified?): - Person Holding (e.g. 30 with an officer RankCode) - Equipment Holding (e.g. 50 PowerTransmissionLines) - Consumable Materiel Holding (e.g. 100 with ClassV (Ammunition) MaterielSupplyClassCode)
TestCaseStep.TestCaseStepResult: Holding information is added to the organisation in Nation A's C2IS. Nation B receives Holding information. The Holding information for the Organisation is the same in the C2ISs of both nations.

TestCaseStep.TestCaseStepAction: Nation A updates the Holding information created in Step 1: - Number of officers changed to 28 - Number of PowerTransmissionLines changed to 75 - Number of ClassV changed to 0.
TestCaseStep.TestCaseStepResult: Holding information is updated in the C2IS of Nation A. Nation B receives and applies the updated information. The Holding information for the Organisation is the same in the C2IS of both nations.
